CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. 2 reads: "Curtis Haines Goes To Rest - Pallbearers and relatives remain silent as Father Matthews, pastor of St. Luke Episcopal Church, delivers the final burial pronouncement over the remains of Curtis B. Haines on Monday. Interment was in Allegheny Cemetery.  Starting left and reading clockwise, pallbearers and relatives were Elmer Yates, Francis Johnson, Irving Johnson, Lieut. Leo Anderson, Father Matthews, Elizabeth Jennings, sister; Carlton Haines, brother; Dolly Warden, sister; Gladys Haines, widow; Russel Shelton, Thomas Robinson, James Goode and William Hannon. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group of men and women, left to right: Elmer Yates, Francis Johnson, Irving Johnson, Lieut. Leo Anderson, Father Matthews, Elizabeth Jennings, sister; Carlton Haines, brother; Dolly Warden, sister; Gladys Haines, widow; Russel Shelton, Thomas Robinson, James Goode and William Hannon, standing on either side of casket in Allegheny Cemetery for Curtis Haines funeral
